etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in British and Foreign Medico-chirurgical Review. From para- + ancient Greek ϕρήν phren + -ia, after French paraphrénie

definitions: In early use: insanity, madness Later: specifically mental illness with prominent paranoid or other delusional symptoms; paranoid schizophrenia.

notes.text: "late paraphrenia" noun a psychotic state with paranoid delusions and hallucinations occurring in the elderly.
